.
Meniere’s Disease
Meniere’s Disease (endolymphatic hydrops) is to be rated
under the criteria in
38 CFR 4.87, DC 6205
which consider frequency of attacks of symptoms including hearing loss (with or without tinnitus) and vertigo and cerebellar gait,
or
by assigning separate evaluations for hearing impairment (
38 CFR 4.85, DC 6100
), tinnitus (
38 CFR 4.87, DC 6210
), and vertigo (rating vertigo as a peripheral vestibular disorder under
38 CFR 4.87, DC 6204
).
Use whichever approach results in a higher evaluation.
Do not
separately assign an evaluation under
38 CFR 4.87, DC 6205
and a rating for hearing loss, tinnitus, or vertigo.
Reference
:  For information on assessment of hearing impairment when evaluating Meniere’s Disease under
38 CFR 4.87, DC 6205
, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, 2.B.2.l
.
